.

Massanjore dam, across the Mayurakshi River, is in Dumka district of Jharkhand State. Built with Candian aid, it is also called Canada Dam or Pearson Dam. It was commissioned in 1956. 

The dam is 155 feet high from its base and is 2170 feet long. The reservoir has an area of 16,650 acres when full and has a storage capacity of 500,000 acre feet. Apart from the Massanjore Dam there is a barrage at Tilpara, near Siuri. The barrage is 1,013 feet long.

It is about 24 kms from Dumka in Jharkhand and is about 45 km from Suri in West Bengal. It is on the Suri-Dumka road. Buses ply on this road.

There are two guesthouses available near to this Dam. One belongs to the Bengal Govt and the other falls in the territory of West Bengal Govt. as this dam is on the Border line within the two states.

This dam is well connected to roads from Dumka and falls in Dumka district of Jharkhand State.

Nice place for family and friends to stay and enjoy the nature.

Walk or have your own transport.

It is very useful.

The place is just amazing for adventurous persons.The broad river,mountains,proper jharkhand gives its identity everywhere.at night,the total ambiance changes.Hill climbing or swimming is pretty much enjoying.

The view of the Dam is very beautiful as many people enjoy looking at the scenic view of the dam.
There are few food stalls which are situated near the dam.to get food at night,u have to arrange within afternoon.rate is pretty cheap.

cold drinks are available near the shops beside the dam.if u can manage the regional "mahua" wine from the tribal villages, it will be an awesome combination.

You can also get fresh Khajor juice once you cross the dam by foot. They charge Rs.3/- per glass. You should carry a bottle to carry the juice. Ravi Asopa 9830161201
